projectGridLines.title: Data Analysis Support to Policy Vertical at J-PAL South Asia
projectGridLines.description:
Title: Data Analysis Support to Policy Vertical at J-PAL South Asia


Host Organization: J-PAL 


Mode of Engagement: Remote


Description: 

The Data intern will be working on multiple activities pertaining to data analysis within the Policy Vertical. It will involve working with senior members of J-PAL staff and contributing to the priority knowledge products, streamlining internal processes, and generating insights from various datasets managed at the organizational level.  


In particular, the Gender sector within the Policy team at J-PAL SA is developing a landscaping note to compile information from existing descriptive and data sources to paint a picture of the scope and scale of gender-based violence (GBV) outside the home in India. To further build out the landscaping note, the data intern would be responsible for analyzing different datasets that capture the incidence of GBV in India (e.g. data from the NFHS, data from apps designed for womenâ€™s safety, crime record data, etc.). They would be responsible for cleaning, merging as well as analyzing data to draw out insights, identifying data gaps, and putting them together in the landscaping note. This note will target a general audience, to convey learnings from existing data on the scope and scale of the problem.


Skill sets: 

  • Well-versed with data cleaning, sorting, and reporting tools like Excel, Tableau, SQL, etc
  • Knowledge of statistics (descriptive and inferential)
  • Intermediate to Advanced proficiency in Stata, R, or Python
  • Data visualization


Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills
  • Passionate about public policy and research


Expected learning: 


This 6-month program is designed to provide hands-on experience in data management under the supervision of JPAL experts while working closely with leading social sector organizations. Throughout the program, you will receive personalized and professional guidance from experienced mentors, fostering your growth as a data professional and enhancing your understanding of real-world challenges.


Specific courses required for project execution:  

  • Any technical/non-technical course with a module/component in statistics/data science
